sentence.text: In a mouse model of colitis-associated colon cancer (CAC), urine level of D2HG during colitis correlates positively with subsequent polyp counts and severity of dysplasia.
The colonic expression of D2HGDH is decreased in ulcerative colitis (UC) patients at baseline who progress to cancer.
Our study identifies urine D2HG and tissue D2HGDH expression as biomarkers to identify patients at risk for progressing from colitis to cancer.
